intro: Metalasia phillipsii subsp. incurva, commonly known as the bent-leaved metalasia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, curved leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
